snippet: Despite high rates of obesity in the populations they work for, groups with a long history of funding by the beverage industry are now fighting measures like New York City’s stalled soda ban.
abstract: Dozens of Hispanic and African-American civil rights groups, health advocacy organizations and business associations have joined the beverage industry in opposing soda regulation, arguing that such measures are discriminatory, paternalistic or ineffective; many of these groups are recipients of tens of millions of dollars from the beverage industry that has flowed to nonprofits and educational organizations.
lead_paragraph: Despite high rates of obesity in the populations they work for, groups with a long history of funding by the beverage industry are now fighting measures like New York City’s stalled soda ban.

headline.seo: Behind Soda Industry’s Win, a Phalanx of Sponsored Minority Groups
headline.main: Minority Groups and Bottlers Team Up in Battles Over Soda
headline.print_headline: Bottlers and Minority Groups, Soda War Allies

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
keywords.name: organizations
